reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the closest I've come to finding something like Nintendo World Cup/Nekketsu High School Dodgeball Club: Soccer on the PC.

I generally don't buy early access games, but this game was on sale for $3.59 and is scheduled to exit early access in July 2016.  Single player and local multiplayer with controller and keyboard support are implemented, and generally work well.  XBox 360/XBox One controllers should work out of the box.  Other controllers should work through X360CE, and oddly enough, my DualShock 2 through a USB adaptor worked, though I did have to remap the buttons.

The downside is that there is no network multiplayer support - only local multiplayer support.  The developers have stated that they're working on adding the support before the game exits early access, and I hope that they do because this game is seriously fun.

I wouldn't suggest buying this game for full price right now, at least until it exits early access.  Pick it up while it's on sale and have a grand old time re-living working through Nintendo World Cup at the age of 8!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the product of what would happen if the fast-paced and thunderbolt world of Super Mario Strikers met the charming and intense world of Sensible Soccer. Sprinkle some unforgettable scenes from Shaolin Soccer and you have Kopanito All-Stars Soccer.

Impressions
+ I have never had so much fun slide tackling in to opponents. Traditional grassroot rules do not apply, so get out there and break those legs!
+ Gameplay is solid and fully responsive between keyboard and gamepad. There is a learning curve involved, but once you discover the importance of team work, dribbling and tackling, everything feels a lot friendlier.
+ Visually a very charming game. The cartoony art direction is certainly a good call and works well. Player animations are solid. Goal celebrations are... ahem... animated.
+ Not a lot to offer in terms of sound effects and soundtrack, but the current offering delivers to a satisfactory standard.
+ A large assortment of competitions to unlock and play through including custom tournaments, practice and friendly matches.
+ Powers can be huge game changers and injects new life to the sport. There are four powers in total with individual strengths and weaknesses.
+ Support for up to four additional local players. Grab your friend(s) and charge through various tournaments as a team.
+ Full keyboard + mouse and gamepad support. Keys can be configured to your heart’s content.
+ The greater the goal difference, the more resilient and alert the AI becomes to your tackles and dribbles. Something I have not seen before, but it's a mechanic which works extremely well in an attempt to avoid further catastrophes.
+ Leaderboard and fame points work really well side by side. Adds a whole different layer of depth for players to continue playing and reach the Platinum League.
+ 225 achievements and in-game trophies. That’s 225 individual pieces of effort and excruciating dedication to unlock.
+ Match challenges offer objectives for players in search of small modifiers (ie. avoid using powers, score three goals in 30 seconds, and so on). You gain fame points in return for your efforts.
+ Friendly user interface with all the standard options you would expect from a PC title.
+ Online multiplayer is planned for release with the final version of the game.

Early access consideration and dev feedback
- A friendly warning: The AI will torture you during your first few sessions/hours until you figure out how everything works. You may even grow suspicious of cheating AI. I most certainly did. The important thing is to try and play as much as you can to get to grips with the gameplay.
- Slight overkill with AI catch up speed compared to player catch up. I don't feel like the sprint button does anything when chasing the AI.
- The need for more power ups or other methods of scoring (ie. volley or header) is great.
- There is an audio balancing issue. Almost all audio during play comes through the right speaker/headphone. I have tried using two perfectly functional headsets and a speaker to cancel any malfunctions on my end.
- Only international teams are playable. It would be great to be able to play in a league filled with fictional teams/players, just to shrug off the feeling of international play. Pro Evolution Soccer has done this for many years with great success (ie. North London: Arsenal; Hampshire Red: Southampton; Merseyside Blue: Everton).
- It would be an even greater feature to allow players the freedom to create their own teams, team names, players and kits from pre-made designs, then to incorporate this team to a randomly generated and fictional league.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a funny skill based football game. Game mostly based on you fast reaction.

In the game you will find in one team of 6 players, your main goal , is should be obviously, because this is a football game, so you should win a match. Beside this you will get for every match different goals like do clean sheet etc. Here to play you can pick a various national teams, but at the start only a few available, other ones you will unlock them when you win a different tournaments in different difficulty level. The basic is a football, but here you will not find too many rules, only some basic like a corned kick, throw in. Also here you will found some special skills what you get randomly after some time and can use it, for example super shoot or teleport.
Here you will find besides a single player tournaments a local multiplayer mode and in future also an online multiplayer.
The game controls are very simple , you can easily learn a basic element, they are well presented in a text with picture, also you can do practice.
The game style well fit to the game style, all characters looks a bit funny, but nice. There you will not find to much sounds, but they are good.

So my verdict:

+enjoyable gameplay
+some unusual in football games
+nice style
+leaderboards
+local multiplayer up to 5 player
+different difficulty levels
+steam cards and achievements

-at the moment no online multiplayer (will come in future)
-in some moments can be frustrating

Well i think this game you should try out even if you are not a football fan. This game looks fun and can bring enjoyable moments for all age players. Gameplay is based in you skills and fast reaction, but after some practice this shouldn´t be a problem for you. So if you want to get some fresh experiences and try out your skills, this game is for you. Game still in early access, but the announced future updates should do this game even more funny and enjoyable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To say the game isn't fun for an hour or two would be a lie. But at a price point of 10.99 (CDN) there just is zero meat on the bone to want to keep playing. It took about 4 hours to play all the tournements on the beginner level to unlock the other ones. Then you are to move up to the next difficulty to again, unlock the next tiers of tournements.

In lies the rub, there is no variety in the games. Yes, it's soccer. But all it is as simply put is; slide tackle, run for 5 feet and then start spinning with the ball and hope the never missing AI might miss a tackle. Then use the sniper mode to aim for one of the corners..... Rinse repeat. That is the whole game. None of the teams have any 'differnce' other then the colours of their shirts/player faces. No team is better then the other and you can NEVER outrun a defender. If you have the ball you run at 75% speed any defenseman can run down forwards. It's just a little silly.

If it's on sale, grab it for a few hours of something sports on Steam. Don't expect it to hold your attention for long once you are past the first few games and your doing the exact thing every game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Imagine a game where your team only consists of O. Khan, Pepe, J. Barton, Gattuso, R. Keane and Diego costa.
And essentially just let them loose because this time there is no ref to sent them off.

The game sounds simple enough, all you got to do is score and everything is legal.
But its alot more challanging then it sounds. Well placed curlers, slide tackles to reach a pass that was a little off, and correctly timed interceptions is pretty much key in this game, aswell as obviously passing, crosses etc.
There is pretty much no time to rest or think of a strategy since its extremely fast paced.

Itll take quite some time befor unlocking every team/tournament, especially on harder difficulties.

Oh and playing this game as a local co-op with friends is def. recommended. Especially local 2vs2 is alot of fun. You will also learn too hate them every time they use a special power.

AWESOME game! Even in Early Access!

Are you a soccer games fan? Do you like to play football?
So this game is ABSOLUTELY for you!

The game is as simple as possible (simplified rules).
At the same time it is as hard as it needed.
The game mechanic is really uncommon and unique!

You may play it with only two buttons.
But if you want to win you HAVE TO use 4-5 more buttons.

It also has some super abilities that add charm to this game.

Moreover the game supports 5 (!) local co-op players.
It is absolutely the case for home parties with friends.
Playing for the same team or organizing home tourney.

Online multiplayer (the key to future success) is coming!
After its implementationt the game will blow the STEAM up!
I'm bet on this!

Can hardly wait when it will finally happen! It would be really GREAT!

P.S.: Responsive developers!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Review
If you don't want to worry about team formation, tatics and you want to play quick and short soccer games, this game was made for you.

Kopanito is a soccer game on Early Access that already has a lot of content:
-16 tournaments and cups to play, but you can also create your own tournament.
-100+ teams from all over the world.
-4 AI difficulty levels
-Super-moves
-Achievements
-Leaderboards
-Controller support

It's an extremely simple soccer game. You pick your team (5 players + 1 goal keeper) and you can play a friendly match or try to win a tournament or cup.
There are no fouls, no referees, no team formation, no tatics, no stamina.
The game has a smooth gameplay, you can tackle as much as you want, but that doesn't mean you're going to easily steal the ball.
When you press and hold the kick button the game slows down and you can change the ball direction, making the goal keeper's life difficult.
The super-moves are a nice addition to the game: you can freeze your opponent, you can use a magnet to pull the ball, you can teleport to another region of the field, you can perform a super shot or use a windmaker to blow the ball away from your goal.
You can play locally with your friends: up to 5 local players, using gamepads and a keyboard.
In the beginning you can play just one tournament. You need to win it on the Beginner level to unlock another tournament and so on.
Even though the game has 100+ teams you can pick just a few in the beginning and you need to unlock the other teams.

Rating:
9/10

Pros: Cartoony and cute graphics.
Simple gameplay.
Nice tutorial.
Achievements.
Short games.
Fast pace.
You can generate GIF from your goals.
Cons:
The team supporters are too quiet.
The AI difficult needs balancing. From the Beginner to the Amateur level it gets way too difficult. The devs are already working on it.
The ball rebounds needs improvement. It's hard control your player.
Lack of multiplayer online, but the devs are already working on it.
For similar reviews and great giveaways please visit Steamified[www.steamified.com]

I bought the game on the winter sale for 5.-

And after one exciting hour of gameplay I would have paid the full price. I totally love the cartoon-look of the game and the more or less easy controls. I can't really fit my thoughts into sentences so here is a little list of what I liked and what I missed:

+ Cartoon-looks (also the very simple menu)
+ Easy-Controls
+ cool Idea of slowmotion when shooting
+ one Challenge in each match (for example: Dribble the ball for 20 seconds)

- many frameratedrops (I have quite a very good PC)
- The practice wasn't playable for me with gamepad. Keyboard always was Player 1. (maybe I did miss how to change that)
- Some translation-mistakes (german)
- After selecting a team, I couldn't press Start Match" with gamepad. Had to do it with Keyboard
- Slowmotion effect didn't really brought action to me (Maybe adding a zoom or something? 0.4 sec of slowmotion didn't really made me "fear" if the ball is going in or not)
- Some Challenges were little bit too hard (Scoring 3 goals in 25 seconds)
- too few Power-ups in 4 minutes of gameplay

What I'm missing in the game and is probably going to come:
- Character (+Ball) customization
- Replays
- Selectable Celebrations
- Harder Challenges get rewarded more
- Online-matches
- Some more crazyness (chaotic gamemodes
date:
((((playing as animals :D)))))
--> more powerups in 4 minute matches


I definitly will write another review of this game in some months
recommended:
when development is more advanced.
I also can't wait to play this game with a group of friends (5 Player can play local).

The developer Merixgames did a very good joob for this point.

Hope the review is helping you to buy this cool game!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“What a superb pass from the midfielder to the winger - he beat the defender fair and square, he is going to score without a doubt! What a move, Ladies and Gentlemen. Exceptional talent displayed from this player but . . . Hold on, WHAT A CRASHIIIING TACKLE from the second defender, so hard that his boots are the only remains on the pitch! Did you see where he landed, guys?” I love commentating Kopanito All-Stars Soccer matches; we see great moves, great tackles and no dives! Plenty of boots here and there but definitely no dives.

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a fast paced arcade-ish sports game. As per the intro, this sports game is absolutely frantic, to say the least! Well, there are no referees on the pitch and we do not care about this silly offside rule. All we have is two teams of six players each who go in to battle fiercely to win the match.  You will be able to use super moves when you fill the energy bar (I call it that), every successful pass, tackle, shot and goal will help you to increase your charge bar. Then you might get the super shot and score; you might get the magnet to pull the ball back to you (this is what Germany used in the Semi-final against Brazil in the latest World cup, for sure); you might teleport a player up field, or even get a massive ventilator behind the net so the ball can’t cross the line! JUST FUN!

16 tournaments and leagues to play either solo or with friends on local multiplayer which supports up to five players (four on gamepads and one at the keyboard) and four levels of difficulty. I would recommend that you start playing on the beginner level for a while and familiarise yourself with the gameplay. As soon as you move up to the amateur, the difficulty increases dramatically.

During each match, you will be given a challenge - if you manage to succeed you will receive points and in-game achievements. 114 national teams to choose from but a large number of them need to be unlocked.

I really like the cartoonish graphics; the game is very well balanced and the controls very responsive.

Positives:
~~~~~~~

-	Really fun gameplay
-	Great cartoon graphics
-	100’s of national teams to play
-	Great number of tournaments and leagues to play (including custom ones)
-	Local multiplayer
-	Trading cards
-	Stacks of achievements

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~

-	The levels of difficulty increase rather steeply

It is fast, fun, competitive and even frustrating at times. Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a must-have!

9/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

Çocukluğumdan beri hem atari hem bilgisayar üzerinden olsun hertürlü futbol oyunlarını almış/denemiş biri olarak söyleyebilirim ki beni cidden eğlendirdi.Fifa veya PES'i kenara bırakın cidden 20tl verip saatlerce haftalarca oynanıcak oyunlardan biri diyebilirim Kopanito All-Star Soccer, Oyun Kick Off (1989) ve Soccer (1987) Oyunlarını andırdı bana :) Oyunda tonlarca achivement olması ayrı bir güzellik iken  oyunda özelliklerde var.


Gameplay/Oynanış

Oynanış oldukça kolay zaten hepimiz alışığız diğer oyunlardan kontrollere herhangi bir farklı birşey yok.Ama diğer oyunlardaki gibi pas pas gol mantığı burada yok diyebilirim pası nereye atıcağımızı şutu nereye atıcağımızı  şut/pas atarken  seçebiliyoruz. ! Ayrıca oyunda üstte belirtiğim gibi SÜPER HAREKETLER de var  (Ball-Magenet ,Teleport, Super-Shot,Windmaker) her saniye kullanabildiğimiz yetenekler değil tabikide 2 tane yetenek barı var biri bizim biri karşı rakibin eğer bu barlar dolarsa ki o kadar kolay değil özel yeteneği kazanıyoruz. Oyunu maksimum 4 gamepad + keyboard ile oynayabilirsiniz. 5 human vs PC tarzı :) Oyunun zorluğunuda seçebiliyoruz bunlar ; Beginner-Amateur-Professional diye 3 farklı gruba ayrılmış. Oyunda 100+ takım, 16 turnuva ,7 stadyum var.


Müzik,Ses/Music

Bir oyunun ana menü müziği bu kadar mı güzel olur arkadaş !


Grafik/Graphic

Oyunun grafiklere söylenicek söz yok  uğraşılmış bir futbol oyununda açıkcası oynanış > grafik olması lazım ki bu algı değişti bu yıllarda. Oyunda low/medium/ultra ayarlarıda yok ha kendimiz ayarlayabiliyoruz ! *-*


Artılar :

+Tonlarca achivement.
+Takım stadyum çeşitliliği
+Ana menü müziği *-*
+ SÜPER HAREKETLER
+ Kontroller çok iyi

EKSİLER

- Oyuna biraz daha süper hareket getirip onları oyun için kendimiz seçmemiz güzel olabilir.
- Kariyer modu lazım ! :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Who doesn’t love some of the World’s Game? Whose not charmed by cute cartoony graphics? I’m sorry if that’s not you but it describes me. I’m not as deeply passionate about football (soccer) as I am about other sports but as a sports mad Australian I do love watching it from time to time and I certainly enjoy playing the hell out of football games. Football Manager, a bit of FIFA, Pro Evolution Soccer, etc. that’s me to a tea. So when I saw Merixgames’ Kopanito All-Stars Soccer on the Steam store I was all over that like a bad rash.

Kopanito is as basic to play as any sports game on Steam. A controller, though I believe that you can play with keyboard, and some two button mashing and you’re all set. Or are you? Although those are all you need to start playing the game caught me by its difficulty in my opening few matches. The goalies were almost impossible to beat. The game seemed to be unbeatable. But then suddenly I worked out a few strategies. Because the game is such a casual game of football so too are the rules. Literally. The tackle button immediately became one my favorite action in the game. Kevin Muscat eat your heart out. The dirtier you play the more chance you have to win because it means that you have a greater likelihood of winning possession. There’s even a special little trick where you can keep attempting to tackle the opposition goalkeeper when they have the ball and occasionally, ever so semi infrequently, will jar the ball loose and into the goal. The only rules that are called are out-of-bounds and corner kicks. The rest of the game is a mad cap free for all. As disappointed as I may sound it actually adds to the casualness of the game which is a good rather than bad. It’s just not going to suit those seeking a hyper realistic experience.

Learning the necessary skills such as shooting, passing, etc. and then ultimately learning how to best utilize the various special power ups that the game has built into it are important on the higher difficulty settings. This will bring those of you who want a casual yet hard and rewarding challenge well and truly worth it. The addition of Steam achievements would be a nice touch later on but for now are unimportant. What is important is getting all of the features the dev team want to put into their game. But there are no massive complaints at this stage. The game looks, plays and feels as good as a casual sports game needs to look.

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is the perfect game for those looking to scratch a sports game itch without having to dive into something as serious as Pro Evolution Soccer or deeper still a Football Manager.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gameplay Is King!

What can I say?  I, along with my 6-year-old son, have completely fallen in love with this game!  This is the best football game on Steam, bar none.  Better than Pro Evo and light-years ahead of FIFA.

It's one of those games where you look at it and think, meh.  Then you play it for the first time and probably still think, meh.  Then you play it a second, a third and a forth time - and then you start to get the feel for it.  Then it becomes amazing!

In my opinion, there have only ever been 2 truly great football games.  Sensible Soccer on the Amiga and ISS Pro Evolution (1 & 2) on the original PlayStation.  You could argue Kick Off 2 to make 3 truly great games, but I always much preferred Sensi!  Kopanito, if the devs can crack it, has the potential to sit proudly beside those 2 (or 3) games.  Quite simply, the potential of this game is enormous.  Given Steam's massive user base and connectivity, something which neither of those previously mentioned greats had the privilege of playing to, Kopanito finds itself on the fringes of greatness.  I really hope it can make it!

The game plays a lot like Super Mario Strikers, which was released on the GameCube in 2005.  It also plays similar to Sensible Soccer, except the ball (usually) always sticks to your feet and the view is horizontal rather than vertical.  If you liked either of those games, I think it's safe to say you will love Kopanito.

The game is still in Early Access.  The presentation is a bit rough around the edges and there are still a few bugs to iron out.  The gameplay is already verging on perfection though.  Just a few tweaks needed to tidy it up.

Like I said, the potential for this game is enormous.  As much as I love it right now, in my opinion, the game needs to try and move away from the style of Super Mario Strikers and become more like Sensible Soccer.  If the devs could somehow manage to incorporate both game types, each one selectable as an option, then that would quite simple be the holy grail!  A game that, I would imagine, would sell by the bucketload...

Regarding the visuals, I wasn't sure about the cartoon look at first, but I've since grown to love it.  Also, I understand the copyright problems regarding kits, but they need to at least be the same basic colours as those in real life.  The kits are easily editable, though and it won't be long before identical kits are available by way of mod files.

I can't wait to see how this game progresses.  I hope, like Sensi and ISS Pro Evo, that I will still be playing Kopanito in 5 or 10 years time.  Please make it happen!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do you wanna play FIFA, with realistic ball physics and ultra crisp 3d models?  Then step away and go jump on origins.  Do you want to get a couple of firneds together and jump into a simplified soccer game that has old school charm with modern accessibility?  Then you've found your hiddne gem.

This game is quite simple to play.  Essentially pass,shoot and turbo buttons.  You also get the ability to slow-mo bend the ball every tiume you shoot.  This allows you to pull off some amazing banana" kicks in your first game.  It's just good arcade sports game fun that reminds why I loved games like NHL 94 so much back in the day.

You can check out some game footage here.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aWXeuZbMGmQ"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I did not want to give a negative review for this game as it is in early access, and the developer does seem to listen to the gamers and work hard, but after only few hours playing, I feel it was more negative then positive at this stage, even though there is a bit of potential in the game as well as an arcade football game.

However, the way the game is right now, all be it in early access, it is very tedious and frustrating and gets boring quite quickly.

The difficulty jump between each setting is quite high I found, and even on amateur was a challenge because the computer AI tends to be able time things very well indeed when for the player it is much more of a challenge, this is ok, but does get frustrating.

There also is not a lot to the gameplay, it gets very samey with so little options and things going on, you tend to get very bored quite quickly. pass, shoot, pass, shoot, pass, shoot with the odd sliding tackle now and again when you can time it right, and trust me, it's more difficult then you think.

As I say, I reluctantly make this a negative review, I wish there was an option for 'neutral' or 'mixed' as I did not hate it, but it did get tedious.

But I will still be following the progress of the game, and see where it goes as there is potential, but it does need a lot more things added to it because even as an arcade game there isn't much to it, obviously we don't expect Fifa options, but basic things like heading aren't even in the game, which while isn't a gamechanger, put ten or so little things like that to the game and it becomes better, The developer does seem to take notice of the feedback and I applaud him, but right now I won't be playing it again for a bit, but will still follow its progress.

Also PLEASE DO NOT listen to people saying it is a sensible soccer or kick off successor, it really isn't at all.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

unlike FIFA where I rage when the ball gets stolen and I have absolutely no idea why, Kopanito makes it very clear what happened

I got laid the f%^& out and my eyes turned into Xs

Short, fast, high intensity games, with a satisfying slide tackle/steal ball mechanic.

Enjoying this immensely, and it has meant I haven't missed PES and FIFA not being on SteamOS yet.

One gripe which I hope the devs fix as the game proceeds through early access, is the lack of control you have over other players on your team after you've taken a shot and bullet time starts, it's pretty much impossible to control what happens if the ball rebounds.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

7 Feb 16: Being that it is still in early access, I'll give the devs the benefit of the doubt on this one. I really enjoy soccer games overall, especially ones that don't take it too seriously. Mario Strikers Charged was one of my all-time favorites and the existing reviews, when I bought Kopantio, reflected the same love for the Wii title.

What I love about this one are:
-The number of teams and tournaments available
-The fact that the teams are small. Five a side plus keeps is perfect.
-Trick shots and trick defence.
-The price is not unreasonable at all

That said, what I find troubling:
-The fact that a majority of the teams and tournaments need to be unlocked and the easier difficulties may still too hard to unlock the things you want to unlock
-The slide-tackling mechanic needs work. Missing a slide tackle is fun when your opponent jukes you, but not when you were a micrometer off on your analog joystick
-My plug in controllers were garbage in Practice mode, but somehow work in other modes

One more troubling thing I should mention:
I have a 10 minute rule, where if I can't have a meaningful game play experience in 10 minutes, I ask for a refund. I did this with Crusader Kings II, as I didn't have a clue of what I was doing. Anyway, It took me a good 20 minutes to figure out the plug in controller situation (I broke my own rule because I wanted to like this game so much). My advice to devs is this: Make this bug your highest priority. People like me don't have too much patience for this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I stopped playing football games a long time ago because the simulated realism was taking over the arcade fun of the genre. I can't stand the sport as a real thing but casual arcade fun is great so I saw this and thought hmm this looks like jokes" The thing that got me is that it is both fun and serious which is fantastic. I don't have to watch stupid transfers and training; I can just play but I have to play well. There's a lot of skill involved in playing this but not necessarily at the start which is good. It gives you time to warm to the controls and play around with the super skills - which are hilarious.

Overall
date: the game may look silly but it's a real football game. The one thing that threw me off was that I had hoped it was an online multiplayer but unfortunately not. Seeing as it is still in Early Access
recommended: hopefully that is something on the developers list for later. Either way
hoursPlayed: it's a great game with loads of content and local multiplayer is possible."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't recommend this game at the moment and I doubt all these faults will be fixed until the final release.

Cons:
- The performance is worse than most AAA games and the FPS oscillation is a very annoying thing that overly affects gameplay
- Sometimes match crashes for no reason and you must restart the match
- AI is a big problem in this game. It cheats many times and do the same movement every time
- The shot without precise shot is a ♥♥♥♥ and go anywhere instead where you aim. Almost impossible to make a goal without precise shot.
- The impossibility of head the ball makes corner kicks a key of sucess to make goals, mainly for AI

Pros:
- Many achievements.
- Rebind controls, even on xbox controller (there is a bug to rebind B button, but if you hold it, you can bypass the return to the previous menu")"
